Design.comm: The player is small, light, and has good sound quality.

cont.entity_a: Can record voice and radio, which an iPod cannot.
cont.entity_b: The FM radio lacks memory for storing favorites. Radio and audio quality are very good.

cont.entity_a: The software interface is a hassle.
cont.entity_b: The software is more solid than previous versions but cannot be compared to iTunes. Software locks the device to one PC for transfers if not registered. The software is required to load music, making it difficult to use. Cannot transfer files using Windows Explorer; must use Sony's software. The software can freeze the computer. The player requires proprietary software to convert MP3s to another format before playing.

cont.entity_a: The battery was bad and would not charge. Holds a charge for a good amount of time. Battery life is about 20 hours unless brightness is increased. It has a long battery life, lasting a week with 4 hours of daily use.
cont.entity_b: Controls, sound, and battery life are great.

cont.entity_a: The screen contrast is poor, making it difficult to see. Screen contrast is low and hard to read outside. Screen is almost impossible to read outdoors. The display is difficult to see in bright sunlight. The screen is sometimes hard to read outside in sunlight.
cont.entity_b: The display is very dim and hard to read in daylight.

cont.entity_a: Must be connected to a computer to charge or delete songs. The USB hookup is very simple.
cont.entity_b: Direct USB connection eliminates the need for extra cables.

cont.entity_a: The buttons are fairly easy to use. The player is easy to use and has an FM radio. The device works straightforwardly like a mass storage system.
cont.entity_b: The menu system is easy and intuitive.

cont.entity_a: Expandable memory with a memory card. The player has expandable memory options. The player doesn't recognize the microSD card.
The interface is lousy, mixing up album order. The software interface is a hassle.

The foam earphone covers disintegrated upon touch. The earphone jack does not stay plugged in snugly. The supplied earbud unit is inferior. Headphones are constructed well but the sound is just average.
Comparable to an iPod but much cheaper.
The device freezes and the free trial to Napster does not work.
The product has minimal and unhelpful instructions.
No separate charger unless purchased separately.
Only allows one playlist at a time.
Sound quality is excellent and it has standard features like shuffle, repeat, and playlist creation.
The equalizer resets when changing artists.

cont.entity_b: The player supports ATRAC and MP3 formats.
